Title: [L09] Mixing testing and production code
Content:
The codebase contains a few duplicated contracts with slightly different, security-relevant behaviors. Specifically:


* The [`BuybackConstructor` contract](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/buyback/BuybackConstructor.sol) is equivalent to the [`Buyback` contract](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/buyback/Buyback.sol), except it allows the deployer to arbitrarily set the contract addresses. It also saves these values as contract variables, which causes the storage layout to differ between the contracts.
* The same observation applies to the [`FlipperDev`](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/flipper/FlipperDev.sol) and [`Flipper`](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/flipper/Flipper.sol) contracts.
* The [`OracleRouterDev` contract](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/oracle/OracleRouter.sol#L63) is equivalent to the [`OracleRouter` contract](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/oracle/OracleRouter.sol#L38), except it allows anyone to arbitrarily set the oracle addresses.


In all cases, we expect the “Constructor” and the “Dev” contracts are intended for testing purposes only, which explains their increased flexibility. As a matter of good practice, consider documenting this in the function comments and moving them to a `test` directory to maintain clearer isolation between the testing and production code.


**Update:** *Acknowledged. The Origin team states:*



> The issue has an easy solution with Solidity’s immutable feature, so that will be implemented once the Solidity version is upgraded.
>
